Name: Alaska (Straub's 1914 recipe)
Ingredients: 10 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Made with an Old Tom gin with amplified botanicals and minimal sugar (some are way too sweet) this is a spiritous and, if you hit the right dilution, tasty and complex cocktail.
History: Adapted from a recipe in Jacques Straub's 1914 book Drinks . The proportions are exactly as per his recipe but Straub calls for his Alaska to be shaken rather than stirred.
Nutrition: One serving of Alaska (Straub's 1914 recipe) contains 173 calories
